column4: hi, I'm tring to run firefox over putty (and xming), but I'm getting a notice that it's allready running. How can I turn it off? (I can't find it anywhere in top)
'killall firefox-bin'
consider ssh -C for speed
can you explain?
-C activates compression, which is useful for slow links. man ssh
but, I'm not sure how to use it ..
ssh -XC remotehost firefox
I'm on a 100mbit network now anyway so I don't reallt need it (it's fast enough for me)
I see. I use X forwarding via DSL, compression is great for that.
ssh: remotehost: Name or service not known
I thought it was obvious. You have to substitute remotehost with the actual name or IP of the remote host.
hehe, sorry :#
oh, you're on putty -- it's probably different then
yes, I thought so
ah well, it works fast enough for me :) (faster from my desktop than from my server anyway)
to bad that, in putty, I need a new session for every application (afaik)
you could also call a script on the remote host that opens all the applications you need: 'firefox & oowriter & vlc'
or does > make it pm ?
ye
yes
Spliffster: please don't use insert to create a user. Use GRANT
there is something on the LAMP page about GRANT syntax
